did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Francis Henry Hereford papers, 1877-1929 (bulk 1890-1919)
did.abstract: This collection contains correspondence, legal papers, and financial records relating to his law practice, chiefly correspondence between Hereford and the various mining corporations, land and cattle companies he represented. Some correspondence relates to the San Pedro Land Grant.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: Francis Henry Hereford papers(AZ 311). Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Francis Henry Hereford was an attorney in Tucson, Ariz.; he served as Pima County District Attorney from 1882-1895 and was a delegate to the first State Constitutional Convention. Hereford specialized in mining and corporation law and was an attorney for several mining companies in southern Arizona.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This collection contains correspondence, legal papers, and financial records relating to his law practice, chiefly correspondence between Hereford and the various mining corporations, land and cattle companies he represented. Some correspondence relates to the San Pedro Land Grant. Additional material concerns political interests, including correspondence from the Tritle family; family history; and Indian depredation claims involving Solomon Warner, Thomas Gardiner, H.C. Hooker, the Aguirre family, and others. Also included are school enrollment statistics for Tucson schools, 1919; and blueprint maps and newspaper clippings concerning a 1915 widening of 6th Avenue in Tucson.

did.unittitle: Benjamin H. Hereford: Certificate as Attorney of the Supreme Court of the Territory of Arizona. Signed by Joseph Neugass, Clerk of the Supreme Court, A. T. January 3, 1877
Benjamin H. Hereford: Certificate of appointment as Notary Public of Pima County. Signed by J. C. Fremont, Governor of Territory of Arizona. March 7, 1881
Benjamin H. Hereford: Certificate of election as District Attorney of Pima County. Signed by William J. Osborn, Clerk of Pima County Board of Supervisors. November 17, 1884
Frank H. Hereford: Certificate to practice in the Supreme Court and other courts of the Territory of Arizona. Signed by E. H. Cook for E. B. Dodge, Clerk of the Supreme Court, A. T. July 8, 1886
Frank H. Hereford: Certificate of election as delegate to the Constitutional Convention of Arizona, representing Pima County. Signed by N. O. Murphy, Secretary of Arizona. June 18, 1891
Frank H. Hereford: Certificate as Attorney and Counsellor of the U. S. Supreme Court. Signed by James H. McKenney, Clerk of the U. S. Supreme Court. March 1, 1907
Frank H. Hereford: Certificate to practice in the Supreme Court and other courts of the Territory of Arizona. Signed by C. F. Leonard, Clerk of the Supreme Court, Arizona. January 24, 1914

Frank H. Hereford: Certificate as proctor, advocate, attorney, solicitor and counsellor of the U. S. District Court, in and for the southern district of California. Signed by T. F. Green for William. M. Van Dyke, Clerk of the Court. December 14, 1917
